ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
Learned the basics like any other language: verb conjugation, Czech culture, simple sentence structure, tenses
Prof. KvK makes sure that the learning curve is just steep enough to move at a quick pace while still absorbing the material

Learned a lot about czech culture. Learned how to read and write in present, past, and future tenses. Learned how to conjugate numerous verbs and how to form sentences. Watched many czech videos and also acted out many small plays.
I learned a basic level of czech and an intro to the language and culture

I learned an immense amount of information and grammar about the Czech language. I had zero knowledge of the Czech language before taking this course and I have grown so much throughout this semester in this language.
The introduction to Czech as a language
Developed a introductory understanding of the Czech language, amazing class!
I have a good foundation of knowledge of the Czech language
I learned how to develop by Czech language-speaking skills through daily repetition and helpful notes/videos by Professor von Kunes.
This was my first time learning about Czech. I really loved the way Professor KVK taught us and went about class everyday.
How to work in groups to develop language skills

I really felt that I became a much better speaker over the course of this term. Our professor really helped us by incorporating oral practice into every class lesson which was super beneficial to my learning.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Prof. KvK is the strength and backbone of the course. She is always open to help in and outside of the classroom to effectively facilitate your Czech learning.
I love czech it was one of the most interesting and fun classes I've had so far at Yale. I think I would learn more if we got more handouts but that is only because I am a very hands on learner.

Strengths are that it is very engaging 
Weakness is meeting everyday seems to much

This course is very engaging, my professor did an excellent job helping individuals new to this course understand the basics of this language. It was always a joy to be in this class everyday of the week knowing that I would learn so much in one hour.
Very engaging and fun class. I would personally keep it the same.
I dont have any weaknesses to state about this class. So much fun and so informational. Profesor Von Kunes is also a fantastic teacher
I think we go at a good, achievable pace
This class was my favorite class I took during the fall. The major strength of the class was how engaged Professor von Kunes was during class every day.
We should do more fundamental grammar and sentence structure work

I really don't think there were many weaknesses in this course. I felt that our professor was always there for us when we needed help, and going over our homework assignments in class along with doing oral practice each day made us all much better Czech students and helped us become more familiar with the language.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I highly recommend this course to another student especially with KvK at the helm.

I would recommend Czech to students who have never really been great at languages. I took french in high school and was always average at it and came to Yale wanting to try something new. Czech allows you to learn about things other than just reading/ writing.
Yes if they want a chance to learn a new and exciting language in a fun and welcoming environment
I would absolutely recommend this course. It is very enjoyable to learn the Czech language from such a great professor.
Yes, if you are interested in Czech, I would definitely take it.
Ofcourse, overall such a positive experience in this class and I still be taking more Czech classes for sure!
Yes! KVK is a great and understanding teacher
Yes. The classroom environment is very welcoming and learning is enjoyable with this class.
Yes. Most kids take the same language their whole middle school/ high school career so it is nice to mix things up.
Definitely. KVK is an awesome teacher

I would definitely recommend this course to another student. I think coming into the course I was worried that Czech would be too difficult of a language to truly learn in so little time. However, our professor made it her job to create amazing lesson plans each day that would force us to challenge ourselves and take steps in the right direction.
